jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)be resolved eventually with no lasting harm

lj.lj_ly: he's not happy but he assures me &B{it'll all come out in the wash}.
lj.lj_ls: 他不高兴，但他向我保证这件事会得到圆满解决的。

jx.jx_en_mean: (of clothes, bedlinen, or similar) put aside for washing or in the process of being washed
jx.jx_cn_mean: （衣服、床单或类似之物）待洗的；正在洗的

phrase.cizu_name: wash one's dirty linen (或 laundry) in public

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)discuss or argue about one's personal affairs in public
go to the toilet (used euphemistically)
disclaim responsibility for

lj.lj_ly: the social services washed their hands of his daughter.
lj.lj_ls: 社会福利机构不再承管他女儿的事。

jx.jx_en_mean: accompany or follow food with a drink

lj.lj_ly: bacon and eggs &B{washed down with} a cup of tea.
lj.lj_ls: 就着一杯茶吃下去的熏肉和鸡蛋。

jx.jx_en_mean: (N. Amer.)be excluded (or exclude someone) from a course or position after a failure to meet the required standards
jx.jx_cn_mean: (北美)（因没有达到要求）（遭）淘汰

lj.lj_ly: a lot of them had washed out of pilot training.
lj.lj_ls: 他们中有许多人已经被淘汰出飞行训练了。

jx.jx_en_mean: clean the inside of something with water
wash something, especially a garment, quickly or briefly
jx.jx_cn_mean: 简单地洗（某物，尤指衣服）

lj.lj_ly: I don't have time to wash a blouse out every night.
lj.lj_ls: 我没有时间每天晚上都洗一下上衣。

jx.jx_en_mean: (一般作 be washed out)cause an event to be postponed or cancelled because of rain

lj.lj_ly: their match against Australia was washed out.
lj.lj_ls: 他们跟澳大利亚队的比赛因下雨而延期进行。

jx.jx_en_mean: (of a flood or downpour) make a breach in a road
To clean by washing with water from top to bottom
jx.jx_cn_mean: 冲洗：用水从头到尾清洗

jx.jx_en_mean: To follow the ingestion of (food, for example) with the ingestion of a liquid
jx.jx_cn_mean: 吞下，咽下：吃下（如食物）后再喝某种液体

lj.lj_ly: washed the cake down with coffee.
lj.lj_ls: 用咖啡把蛋糕冲下肚去

jx.jx_en_mean: To remove or be removed by washing.

lj.lj_ly: color that had been washed out by bleach.

jx.jx_en_mean: To carry or wear away or be carried or worn away by the action of moving water

lj.lj_ly: The river rose and washed out the dam. The road has washed out five miles down the mountain.
lj.lj_ls: 河水陡涨，冲垮了大坝。山下的路被冲坏的有五英里

jx.jx_en_mean: To deplete or become depleted of vitality

lj.lj_ly: By evening, I was washed out from overwork.
lj.lj_ls: 到了傍晚，我被过多的工作累得精疲力尽

jx.jx_en_mean: To eliminate or be eliminated as unsatisfactory
jx.jx_cn_mean: 删除：因不满意而删除或被删除

lj.lj_ly: a football player who was washed out; an officer candidate who washed out after one month.
lj.lj_ls: 被罚下场的足球队员；一月后被免职的候选官员

jx.jx_en_mean: To cause (an event) to be rained out.
To wash one's hands.
&I{Chiefly British} To wash dishes after a meal.
jx.jx_cn_mean: &I{【多用于英国】} 餐后刷盘子

jx.jx_en_mean: To burn out; exhaust

lj.lj_ly: She's all washed up as an editor.
lj.lj_ls: 她做编辑工作累得精疲力竭

jx.jx_en_mean: To be revealed eventually
jx.jx_cn_mean: 暴露，真相大白：最终被揭露出来

lj.lj_ly: The real reasons for her resignation will come out in the wash.
lj.lj_ls: 她辞职的真正原因终究会真相大白的

jx.jx_en_mean: To turn out well in the end

lj.lj_ly: Don't worry: this project will come out in the wash.
lj.lj_ls: 不要着急：这项工程会有好结果的

phrase.cizu_name: come out in the wash&I{【俚语】}

jx.jx_en_mean: To refuse to accept responsibility for.
To abandon; renounce.

means.word_mean: 洗,洗涤;洗掉
其他释义

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English wæscan (verb), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch wassen, German waschen, also to water

encyclopedia.content: wash KK: [] DJ: [] vt. ⒈ 洗，洗涤 She washed her face and hands,then went downstairs. 她洗了脸和手之后走下楼去。 ⒉ 冲掉，冲走[O][(+away)] ⒊ 冲击，拍打；漫过；流过 ⒋ 洗掉[(+off/away)] They washed those marks off the wall. 他们把墙上的那些印记洗掉了。 ⒌ 洗成[O8] ⒍ 洗刷（罪过） He is trying to wash away his sins. 他正试图洗刷他的罪过。 ⒎ 粉刷，涂（漆、颜料）于；镀金属薄层于 vi. ⒈ 洗手；洗脸

entry.def: If you wash something, you clean it using water and usually a substance such as soap or detergent.

example.ex: He got a job washing dishes in a pizza parlour...
example.tran: 他在比萨店里找到一份洗盘子的工作。

example.ex: The colours gently fade each time you wash the shirt...
example.tran: 衬衣每洗一次都会褪点色。

entry.def: If you wash or if you wash part of your body, especially your hands and face, you clean part of your body using soap and water.

example.ex: They looked as if they hadn't washed in days...
example.tran: 他们看起来好像已经有好些天没洗澡了。

example.ex: She washed her face with cold water...

entry.def: If a sea or river washes somewhere, it flows there gently. You can also say that something carried by a sea or river washes or is washed somewhere.

example.ex: The sea washed against the shore...
The oil washed ashore on roughly 1,000 miles of coastline...
example.tran: 石油沿着海岸线扩散到了大约1,000英里范围的沿岸海域。

entry.def: The wash of a boat is the wave that it causes on either side as it moves through the water.
If a feeling washes over you, you suddenly feel it very strongly and cannot control it.

example.ex: A wave of self-consciousness can wash over her when someone new enters the room...
example.tran: 一有陌生人进房间，她就感到极不自在。

example.ex: The overpowering despair that he'd fought so hard to keep at bay washed through the boy.
example.tran: 一直极力压制的绝望情绪终于将男孩击垮了。

entry.def: A wash of something such as light or colour is a thin layer of it.

example.ex: The lights from the truck sent a wash of pale light over the snow.
example.tran: 卡车的车灯在雪地上洒下一层淡淡的光。

entry.def: If you say that an excuse or idea will not wash, you mean that people will not accept or believe it.

example.ex: He said her policies didn't work and the excuses didn't wash...
example.tran: 他认为她的政策没有起到效果，而且理由也不能令人信服。

example.ex: If they believe that solution would wash with the Haitian people, they are making a dramatic error.
example.tran: 如果他们认为海地人会接受那个解决方案，那他们就大错特错了。

entry.def: If you say that something will come out in the wash, you mean that people will eventually find out the truth about it.

example.ex: This will all come out in the wash—I promise you.
example.tran: 一切终会真相大白的——我向你保证。

entry.tran: 正在洗着;将要洗;刚洗过
entry.def: If you say that something such as an item of clothing is in the wash, you mean that it is being washed, is waiting to be washed, or has just been washed and should therefore not be worn or used.

example.ex: Your jeans are in the wash.
example.tran: 你的牛仔裤还在洗着呢。

means.word_mean: 1. a thin coat of water-base paint
2. the work of cleansing (usually with soap and water)
3. the dry bed of an intermittent stream (as at the bottom of a canyon)
4. the erosive process of washing away soil or gravel by water (as from a roadway);

sentences.sentence: "from the house they watched the washout of their newly seeded lawn by the water"

means.word_mean: 5. the flow of air that is driven backwards by an aircraft propeller
6. a watercolor made by applying a series of monochrome washes one over the other
7. garments or white goods that can be cleaned by laundering
8. any enterprise in which losses and gains cancel out;

sentences.sentence: "at the end of the year the accounting department showed that it was a wash"

means.word_mean: 1. clean with some chemical process
2. cleanse (one's body) with soap and water
3. cleanse with a cleaning agent, such as soap, and water;
4. move by or as if by water;

sentences.sentence: "The swollen river washed away the footbridge"

means.word_mean: 5. be capable of being washed;
6. admit to testing or proof;

sentences.sentence: "This silly excuse won't wash in traffic court"

means.word_mean: 7. separate dirt or gravel from (precious minerals)
8. apply a thin coating of paint, metal, etc., to
9. remove by the application of water or other liquid and soap or some other cleaning agent;

sentences.sentence: "he washed the dirt from his coat"
"Can you wash away the spots on the windows?"
"he managed to wash out the stains"

means.word_mean: 10. form by erosion;

sentences.sentence: "The river washed a ravine into the mountainside"

means.word_mean: 11. make moist;
12. wash or flow against;
13. to cleanse (itself or another animal) by licking;

sentences.sentence: "The cat washes several times a day"

list.explanation: 洗澡(专指洗擦上半身的沐浴)

example.en: She is giving her boy a Liverpool wash.
example.zh: 她正在替她的儿子擦洗上身。

abbreviation.mean_cn: 洗涤设备，清洗机；垫片，环

Sentence.sentence: Bedrooms and cars are the most obvious examples, but you can also rent camping spaces in Sweden, fields in Australia and washing machines in France
French fries, washed down with a pint of soda, are a favorite part of fast-food lunches and dinners for millions of American youngsters.
In the future, more effective washing techniques, management procedures, and recycling and purification of water will be needed to reduce wastage.
They are expensive, and I've heard the printing fades easily when you wash them.

means.word_mean: 洗; 洗涤
冲, 拍打

sentences.en: A breeze washed against her face.

means.word_mean: 耐洗, 经洗

sentences.en: If the suit won't wash, it must be dry-cleaned.
sentences.cn: 如果这套西服经不住水洗, 就得干洗了。

means.word_mean: 洗涤；洗脸，洗手(常与 up 连用)

sentences.en: To wash before dinner is good for our health.
sentences.cn: 饭前洗手对健康有好处。

means.word_mean: (波涛等)拍打;溅泼;流过;漂浮(与 over, against, along, up 等连用)

sentences.en: We could hear the waves washing against the rocks.
sentences.cn: 我们可以听到海浪拍打岩石的声音。

means.word_mean: 使人接受；令人相信

sentences.en: The story in this newspaper didn't wash with us.
sentences.cn: 这张报纸上报道的消息让我们难以相信。

means.word_mean: 要洗的衣物的数量

sentences.en: I have a large wash this Sunday.
sentences.cn: 这星期天我有一大堆衣服要洗。

jushi.english: A breeze washed against her face.
You were very dusty and went up to my room to wash.
jushi.chinese: 你身上土很多,上楼到我房间里去洗一洗。
